title: TubeStars (Ages 10-13) - Solon, OH
description: Does your child dream of becoming the next big YouTube star? In TubeStars Camp, campers learn the entire video production process: storyboarding, scripting, filming, editing, and promotion. Campers use webcams, ring lights, and Shotcut for Windows to create multiple types of YouTube videos. Videos created in this camp are saved on a complimentary USB drive to share with friends or family on Windows and Mac computers. Special Note: Campers do not upload videos to any video sharing platform during camp; instead, campers are provided with instructions for how to upload their projects to a video sharing platform with the help of parents at home. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

description: Creative Coders Camp is a perfect introduction to coding! Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: Game Builders (Ages 7-9) - Solon, OH
description: In Game Builders Camp, campers build on their love of video games by learning how to make their own. Kids design their own video games with exciting challenges, innovative gameplay, and fun characters using the software Kodu from Microsoft. Campers are encouraged to play each other's games, offering feedback, suggestions and encouragement. Video games created in this camp are saved on a complimentary USB drive to play with friends and family on Windows computers. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: Minecraft Coding (Ages 9-13) - Solon, OH
description: In Minecraft Coding Camp, kids don't just play Minecraft, they create their own worlds with code! If your child loves Minecraft and wants to learn how to design and program new ideas into their worlds, then they will love this awesome camp. Kids become the ruler of their own world, controlling mobs and creatures, and learning to change, customize and edit their tools and weapons. Campers learn how to code with a block-based visual programming language inside MinecraftEdu, using if-then and while-do statements, variables, and loops. Redstone software is used to create circuits and switches to control objects. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: LEGO Robotics (Ages 10-13) - Solon, OH
description: In LEGO Robotics Camp, become a leader of tomorrow by learning how to engineer solutions for some of today's real-world challenges. Kids learn engineering, automation, and problem-solving while programming their LEGO robots to solve a series of innovative challenges. A key advantage to this LEGO Robotics Camp is that campers use a dedicated laptop and LEGO Mindstorms EV3 Robotics kit during the camp for fully engaged learning. LEGO robots remain at camp; pictures of robots and LEGO creations are digitally sent home after camp. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: Brick Flicks (Ages 9-13) - Solon, OH
description: Lights, Camera, LEGO! In Brick Flicks Film Camp, campers get to make multiple stop motion animation movies while learning techniques like video editing, voice over, captioning, and green-screening. Campers get to use their creativity, LEGO bricks, and LEGO mini-figures to develop their very own stories and put them on film. Stop-motion movies produced in camp are saved on a complementary USB drive to share with friends and family on Windows or Mac computers. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: LEGO Bots (Ages 7-9) - Solon, OH
description: In LEGO Bots Camp, kids bring their LEGO creations to life. Using LEGO WeDo technology, campers will build multiple animal-themed robots and code them to complete tasks, react with sensors, and emit sounds. Campers also gain an age appropriate understanding of environmental science in this camp. LEGO robots remain at camp; pictures of robots and LEGO creations are digitally sent home after camp. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: Amazing Architects (Ages 6-9) - Berea, OH
description: Does your child love to build and create? Then your future engineer will love Amazing Architects Camp. In this camp, kids learn what it means to be an Architectural Engineer. Through hands-on activities, campers develop a city, build skyscrapers, model suspension bridges, and environmentally-friendly cars. Then, they take to the skies and learn about planes - how they work, how they're designed, and how to make them fly faster and longer. Note: Computers are not used in this camp; and if your child was enrolled in Amazing Architects or Planes Trains and Auto Engineers after school club, some of the material may be familiar. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: Video Game Design (Ages 10-13) - Berea, OH
description: In Game Design Camp, campers transform from gamer into game developer! Kids take their passion for video games to a new level by learning to develop their own playable video games. Campers design an array of arcade-style video games by applying key skills of character development, environment creation, and innovative gameplay with GameMaker software. Kids are provided access to a copy of the GameMaker software and a library of graphics and music files to continue to develop the video games they make in camp or create new ones. Video games produced in camp are saved on a complementary USB drive to play with friends and family on Windows computers. Enroll today as space is limited. title: TubeStars (Ages 10-13) - Berea, OH
description: Does your child dream of becoming the next big YouTube star? In TubeStars Camp, campers learn the entire video production process: storyboarding, scripting, filming, editing, and promotion. Campers use webcams, ring lights, and Shotcut for Windows to create multiple types of YouTube videos. Videos created in this camp are saved on a complimentary USB drive to share with friends or family on Windows and Mac computers. Special Note: Campers do not upload videos to any video sharing platform during camp; instead, campers are provided with instructions for how to upload their projects to a video sharing platform with the help of parents at home. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: Minecraft Coding (Ages 9-13) - Berea, OH
description: In Minecraft Coding Camp, kids don't just play Minecraft, they create their own worlds with code! If your child loves Minecraft and wants to learn how to design and program new ideas into their worlds, then they will love this awesome camp. Kids become the ruler of their own world, controlling mobs and creatures, and learning to change, customize and edit their tools and weapons. Campers learn how to code with a block-based visual programming language inside MinecraftEdu, using if-then and while-do statements, variables, and loops. Redstone software is used to create circuits and switches to control objects. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: LEGO Robotics (Ages 10-13) - Berea, OH
description: In LEGO Robotics Camp, become a leader of tomorrow by learning how to engineer solutions for some of today's real-world challenges. Kids learn engineering, automation, and problem-solving while programming their LEGO robots to solve a series of innovative challenges. A key advantage to this LEGO Robotics Camp is that campers use a dedicated laptop and LEGO Mindstorms EV3 Robotics kit during the camp for fully engaged learning. LEGO robots remain at camp; pictures of robots and LEGO creations are digitally sent home after camp. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: Kid Coders (Ages 6-8) - Berea, OH
description: In Kid Coders Camp, campers learn and apply code to animate stories, create games, and make characters that move, jump, dance, and sing. Kid Coders is designed to match a young child's cognitive, personal, social, and emotional development and encourage them to have fun creating with code. In this summer kid coding camp kids use ScratchJr visual programming language. Note: tablets provided by Classroom Antics are used in this camp. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: LEGO Bots (Ages 7-9) - Berea, OH
description: In LEGO Bots Camp, kids bring their LEGO creations to life. Using LEGO WeDo technology, campers will build multiple animal-themed robots and code them to complete tasks, react with sensors, and emit sounds. Campers also gain an age appropriate understanding of environmental science in this camp. LEGO robots remain at camp; pictures of robots and LEGO creations are digitally sent home after camp. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: Amazing Architects (Ages 6-9) - Westlake, OH
description: Does your child love to build and create? Then your future engineer will love Amazing Architects Camp. In this camp, kids learn what it means to be an Architectural Engineer. Through hands-on activities, campers develop a city, build skyscrapers, model suspension bridges, and environmentally-friendly cars. Then, they take to the skies and learn about planes - how they work, how they're designed, and how to make them fly faster and longer. Note: Computers are not used in this camp; and if your child was enrolled in Amazing Architects or Planes Trains and Auto Engineers after school club, some of the material may be familiar. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: Creative Coders (Ages 8-12) - Westlake, OH
description: Creative Coders Camp is a perfect introduction to coding! Kids have a blast using Scratch and Makey Makey, as well as both sides of their brain to program their own animated stories and interactive games. The visual programming language used in this camp is simple and straightforward, yet powerful in what it teaches and can accomplish. Programs created in this camp are playable on Windows computers and are saved on a complimentary USB drive to share with friends and family at home. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: TubeStars (Ages 10-13) - Westlake, OH
description: Does your child dream of becoming the next big YouTube star? In TubeStars Camp, campers learn the entire video production process: storyboarding, scripting, filming, editing, and promotion. Campers use webcams, ring lights, and Shotcut for Windows to create multiple types of YouTube videos. Videos created in this camp are saved on a complimentary USB drive to share with friends or family on Windows and Mac computers. Special Note: Campers do not upload videos to any video sharing platform during camp; instead, campers are provided with instructions for how to upload their projects to a video sharing platform with the help of parents at home. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: Minecraft Coding (Ages 9-13) - Westlake, OH
description: In Minecraft Coding Camp, kids don't just play Minecraft, they create their own worlds with code! If your child loves Minecraft and wants to learn how to design and program new ideas into their worlds, then they will love this awesome camp. Kids become the ruler of their own world, controlling mobs and creatures, and learning to change, customize and edit their tools and weapons. Campers learn how to code with a block-based visual programming language inside MinecraftEdu, using if-then and while-do statements, variables, and loops. Redstone software is used to create circuits and switches to control objects. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

To inspire, excite, and enrich the lives of children in today\'s world focused on science and technology. To deliver educational hands-on STEM\xa0programs that promote enrichment, creativity, and teamwork in the safest environment possible. And most importantly, have fun.

Why the Company was Founded

Classroom Antics was established to address the rising demand for STEM-based childhood education. Over the past decades, our world has been turned upside-down with technological and scientific advances. Today, children are more comfortable with video games than board games, and more likely to read books on a smart device than in paperback. title: Kid Coders (Ages 6-8) - Westlake, OH
description: In Kid Coders Camp, campers learn and apply code to animate stories, create games, and make characters that move, jump, dance, and sing. Kid Coders is designed to match a young child's cognitive, personal, social, and emotional development and encourage them to have fun creating with code. In this summer kid coding camp kids use ScratchJr visual programming language. Note: tablets provided by Classroom Antics are used in this camp. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: Video Game Design (Ages 10-13) - Westlake, OH
description: In Game Design Camp, campers transform from gamer into game developer! Kids take their passion for video games to a new level by learning to develop their own playable video games. Campers design an array of arcade-style video games by applying key skills of character development, environment creation, and innovative gameplay with GameMaker software. Kids are provided access to a copy of the GameMaker software and a library of graphics and music files to continue to develop the video games they make in camp or create new ones. Video games produced in camp are saved on a complementary USB drive to play with friends and family on Windows computers. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: Amazing Architects (Ages 6-9) - Fairlawn, OH
description: Does your child love to build and create? Then your future engineer will love Amazing Architects Camp. In this camp, kids learn what it means to be an Architectural Engineer. Through hands-on activities, campers develop a city, build skyscrapers, model suspension bridges, and environmentally-friendly cars. Then, they take to the skies and learn about planes - how they work, how they're designed, and how to make them fly faster and longer. Note: Computers are not used in this camp; and if your child was enrolled in Amazing Architects or Planes Trains and Auto Engineers after school club, some of the material may be familiar. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: LEGO Robotics (Ages 10-13) - Westlake, OH
description: In LEGO Robotics Camp, become a leader of tomorrow by learning how to engineer solutions for some of today's real-world challenges. Kids learn engineering, automation, and problem-solving while programming their LEGO robots to solve a series of innovative challenges. A key advantage to this LEGO Robotics Camp is that campers use a dedicated laptop and LEGO Mindstorms EV3 Robotics kit during the camp for fully engaged learning. LEGO robots remain at camp; pictures of robots and LEGO creations are digitally sent home after camp. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: Brick Flicks (Ages 9-13) - Westlake, OH
description: Lights, Camera, LEGO! In Brick Flicks Film Camp, campers get to make multiple stop motion animation movies while learning techniques like video editing, voice over, captioning, and green-screening. Campers get to use their creativity, LEGO bricks, and LEGO mini-figures to develop their very own stories and put them on film. Stop-motion movies produced in camp are saved on a complementary USB drive to share with friends and family on Windows or Mac computers. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: LEGO Bots (Ages 7-9) - Westlake, OH
description: In LEGO Bots Camp, kids bring their LEGO creations to life. Using LEGO WeDo technology, campers will build multiple animal-themed robots and code them to complete tasks, react with sensors, and emit sounds. Campers also gain an age appropriate understanding of environmental science in this camp. LEGO robots remain at camp; pictures of robots and LEGO creations are digitally sent home after camp. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: Video Game Design (Ages 10-13) - Fairlawn, OH
description: In Game Design Camp, campers transform from gamer into game developer! Kids take their passion for video games to a new level by learning to develop their own playable video games. Campers design an array of arcade-style video games by applying key skills of character development, environment creation, and innovative gameplay with GameMaker software. Kids are provided access to a copy of the GameMaker software and a library of graphics and music files to continue to develop the video games they make in camp or create new ones. Video games produced in camp are saved on a complementary USB drive to play with friends and family on Windows computers. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: TubeStars (Ages 10-13) - Fairlawn, OH
description: Does your child dream of becoming the next big YouTube star? In TubeStars Camp, campers learn the entire video production process: storyboarding, scripting, filming, editing, and promotion. Campers use webcams, ring lights, and Shotcut for Windows to create multiple types of YouTube videos. Videos created in this camp are saved on a complimentary USB drive to share with friends or family on Windows and Mac computers. Special Note: Campers do not upload videos to any video sharing platform during camp; instead, campers are provided with instructions for how to upload their projects to a video sharing platform with the help of parents at home. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: Kid Coders (Ages 6-8) - Fairlawn, OH
description: In Kid Coders Camp, campers learn and apply code to animate stories, create games, and make characters that move, jump, dance, and sing. Kid Coders is designed to match a young child's cognitive, personal, social, and emotional development and encourage them to have fun creating with code. In this summer kid coding camp kids use ScratchJr visual programming language. Note: tablets provided by Classroom Antics are used in this camp. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

description: Creative Coders Camp is a perfect introduction to coding! Programs created in this camp are playable on Windows computers and are saved on a complimentary USB drive to share with friends and family at home. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: Minecraft Coding (Ages 9-13) - Fairlawn, OH
description: In Minecraft Coding Camp, kids don't just play Minecraft, they create their own worlds with code! If your child loves Minecraft and wants to learn how to design and program new ideas into their worlds, then they will love this awesome camp. Kids become the ruler of their own world, controlling mobs and creatures, and learning to change, customize and edit their tools and weapons. Campers learn how to code with a block-based visual programming language inside MinecraftEdu, using if-then and while-do statements, variables, and loops. Redstone software is used to create circuits and switches to control objects. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

To inspire, excite, and enrich the lives of children in today\'s world focused on science and technology. To deliver educational hands-on STEM\xa0programs that promote enrichment, creativity, and teamwork in the safest environment possible. And most importantly, have fun.

Why the Company was Founded

Classroom Antics was established to address the rising demand for STEM-based childhood education. Over the past decades, our world has been turned upside-down with technological and scientific advances. Today, children are more comfortable with video games than board games, and more likely to read books on a smart device than in paperback. But how do we prepare our children to use and, better yet, invent tomorrow\'s technological or scientific advancement? Classroom Antics was formed to help kids do just that, apply their knowledge and creativity, to learn to make the next round of advancements in our world for themselves. We hire the best and brightest teachers to educate your children. They are leaders in their communities and contribute to children\'s education on a regular basis. title: LEGO Robotics (Ages 10-13) - Fairlawn, OH
description: In LEGO Robotics Camp, become a leader of tomorrow by learning how to engineer solutions for some of today's real-world challenges. Kids learn engineering, automation, and problem-solving while programming their LEGO robots to solve a series of innovative challenges. A key advantage to this LEGO Robotics Camp is that campers use a dedicated laptop and LEGO Mindstorms EV3 Robotics kit during the camp for fully engaged learning. LEGO robots remain at camp; pictures of robots and LEGO creations are digitally sent home after camp. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: Brick Flicks (Ages 9-13) - Fairlawn, OH
description: Lights, Camera, LEGO! In Brick Flicks Film Camp, campers get to make multiple stop motion animation movies while learning techniques like video editing, voice over, captioning, and green-screening. Campers get to use their creativity, LEGO bricks, and LEGO mini-figures to develop their very own stories and put them on film. Stop-motion movies produced in camp are saved on a complementary USB drive to share with friends and family on Windows or Mac computers. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: LEGO Bots (Ages 7-9) - Fairlawn, OH
description: In LEGO Bots Camp, kids bring their LEGO creations to life. Using LEGO WeDo technology, campers will build multiple animal-themed robots and code them to complete tasks, react with sensors, and emit sounds. Campers also gain an age appropriate understanding of environmental science in this camp. LEGO robots remain at camp; pictures of robots and LEGO creations are digitally sent home after camp. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: Video Game Design (Ages 10-13) - Hudson, OH
description: In Game Design Camp, campers transform from gamer into game developer! Kids take their passion for video games to a new level by learning to develop their own playable video games. Campers design an array of arcade-style video games by applying key skills of character development, environment creation, and innovative gameplay with GameMaker software. Kids are provided access to a copy of the GameMaker software and a library of graphics and music files to continue to develop the video games they make in camp or create new ones. Video games produced in camp are saved on a complementary USB drive to play with friends and family on Windows computers. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: Creative Coders (Ages 8-12) - Hudson, OH
description: Creative Coders Camp is a perfect introduction to coding! Kids have a blast using Scratch and Makey Makey, as well as both sides of their brain to program their own animated stories and interactive games. The visual programming language used in this camp is simple and straightforward, yet powerful in what it teaches and can accomplish. Programs created in this camp are playable on Windows computers and are saved on a complimentary USB drive to share with friends and family at home. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: Amazing Architects (Ages 6-9) - Hudson, OH
description: Does your child love to build and create? Then your future engineer will love Amazing Architects Camp. In this camp, kids learn what it means to be an Architectural Engineer. Through hands-on activities, campers develop a city, build skyscrapers, model suspension bridges, and environmentally-friendly cars. Then, they take to the skies and learn about planes - how they work, how they're designed, and how to make them fly faster and longer. Note: Computers are not used in this camp; and if your child was enrolled in Amazing Architects or Planes Trains and Auto Engineers after school club, some of the material may be familiar. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

To inspire, excite, and enrich the lives of children in today\'s world focused on science and technology. To deliver educational hands-on STEM\xa0programs that promote enrichment, creativity, and teamwork in the safest environment possible. And most importantly, have fun.

Why the Company was Founded

Classroom Antics was established to address the rising demand for STEM-based childhood education. Over the past decades, our world has been turned upside-down with technological and scientific advances. Today, children are more comfortable with video games than board games, and more likely to read books on a smart device than in paperback. But how do we prepare our children to use and, better yet, invent tomorrow\'s technological or scientific advancement? Classroom Antics was formed to help kids do just that, apply their knowledge and creativity, to learn to make the next round of advancements in our world for themselves. We do this using a series of hands-on enrichment programs focused on the key areas of Science, Technology\ufeff, Engineering and Math (STEM) using curriculums\ufeff that\xa0are engaging and fun to appeal to young minds.\xa0

Who are our Teachers\xa0

We hire the best and brightest teachers to educate your children. They are leaders in their communities and contribute to children\'s education on a regular basis. Most of our instructors are school teachers with previous classroom experience. As well, all instructors are fingerprinted and background checked through the FBI (National) and BCI (State of Ohio) database systems to ensure the safest possible classroom environment.

title: TubeStars (Ages 10-13) - Hudson, OH
description: Does your child dream of becoming the next big YouTube star? In TubeStars Camp, campers learn the entire video production process: storyboarding, scripting, filming, editing, and promotion. Campers use webcams, ring lights, and Shotcut for Windows to create multiple types of YouTube videos. Videos created in this camp are saved on a complimentary USB drive to share with friends or family on Windows and Mac computers. Special Note: Campers do not upload videos to any video sharing platform during camp; instead, campers are provided with instructions for how to upload their projects to a video sharing platform with the help of parents at home. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: Minecraft Coding (Ages 9-13) - Hudson, OH
description: In Minecraft Coding Camp, kids don't just play Minecraft, they create their own worlds with code! If your child loves Minecraft and wants to learn how to design and program new ideas into their worlds, then they will love this awesome camp. Kids become the ruler of their own world, controlling mobs and creatures, and learning to change, customize and edit their tools and weapons. Campers learn how to code with a block-based visual programming language inside MinecraftEdu, using if-then and while-do statements, variables, and loops. Redstone software is used to create circuits and switches to control objects. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: LEGO Robotics (Ages 10-13) - Hudson, OH
description: In LEGO Robotics Camp, become a leader of tomorrow by learning how to engineer solutions for some of today's real-world challenges. Kids learn engineering, automation, and problem-solving while programming their LEGO robots to solve a series of innovative challenges. A key advantage to this LEGO Robotics Camp is that campers use a dedicated laptop and LEGO Mindstorms EV3 Robotics kit during the camp for fully engaged learning. LEGO robots remain at camp; pictures of robots and LEGO creations are digitally sent home after camp. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: Game Builders (Ages 7-9) - Hudson, OH
description: In Game Builders Camp, campers build on their love of video games by learning how to make their own. Kids design their own video games with exciting challenges, innovative gameplay, and fun characters using the software Kodu from Microsoft. Campers are encouraged to play each other's games, offering feedback, suggestions and encouragement. Video games created in this camp are saved on a complimentary USB drive to play with friends and family on Windows computers. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: Kid Coders (Ages 6-8) - Hudson, OH
description: In Kid Coders Camp, campers learn and apply code to animate stories, create games, and make characters that move, jump, dance, and sing. Kid Coders is designed to match a young child's cognitive, personal, social, and emotional development and encourage them to have fun creating with code. In this summer kid coding camp kids use ScratchJr visual programming language. Note: tablets provided by Classroom Antics are used in this camp. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: LEGO Bots (Ages 7-9) - Hudson, OH
description: In LEGO Bots Camp, kids bring their LEGO creations to life. Using LEGO WeDo technology, campers will build multiple animal-themed robots and code them to complete tasks, react with sensors, and emit sounds. Campers also gain an age appropriate understanding of environmental science in this camp. LEGO robots remain at camp; pictures of robots and LEGO creations are digitally sent home after camp. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: Amazing Architects (Ages 6-9) - Brunswick, OH
description: Does your child love to build and create? Then your future engineer will love Amazing Architects Camp. In this camp, kids learn what it means to be an Architectural Engineer. Through hands-on activities, campers develop a city, build skyscrapers, model suspension bridges, and environmentally-friendly cars. Then, they take to the skies and learn about planes - how they work, how they're designed, and how to make them fly faster and longer. Note: Computers are not used in this camp; and if your child was enrolled in Amazing Architects or Planes Trains and Auto Engineers after school club, some of the material may be familiar. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: Creative Coders (Ages 8-12) - Brunswick, OH
description: Creative Coders Camp is a perfect introduction to coding! Kids have a blast using Scratch and Makey Makey, as well as both sides of their brain to program their own animated stories and interactive games. The visual programming language used in this camp is simple and straightforward, yet powerful in what it teaches and can accomplish. Programs created in this camp are playable on Windows computers and are saved on a complimentary USB drive to share with friends and family at home. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: Brick Flicks (Ages 9-13) - Hudson, OH
description: Lights, Camera, LEGO! In Brick Flicks Film Camp, campers get to make multiple stop motion animation movies while learning techniques like video editing, voice over, captioning, and green-screening. Campers get to use their creativity, LEGO bricks, and LEGO mini-figures to develop their very own stories and put them on film. Stop-motion movies produced in camp are saved on a complementary USB drive to share with friends and family on Windows or Mac computers. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: Video Game Design (Ages 10-13) - Brunswick, OH
description: In Game Design Camp, campers transform from gamer into game developer! Kids take their passion for video games to a new level by learning to develop their own playable video games. Campers design an array of arcade-style video games by applying key skills of character development, environment creation, and innovative gameplay with GameMaker software. Kids are provided access to a copy of the GameMaker software and a library of graphics and music files to continue to develop the video games they make in camp or create new ones. Video games produced in camp are saved on a complementary USB drive to play with friends and family on Windows computers. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: TubeStars (Ages 10-13) - Brunswick, OH
description: Does your child dream of becoming the next big YouTube star? In TubeStars Camp, campers learn the entire video production process: storyboarding, scripting, filming, editing, and promotion. Campers use webcams, ring lights, and Shotcut for Windows to create multiple types of YouTube videos. Videos created in this camp are saved on a complimentary USB drive to share with friends or family on Windows and Mac computers. Special Note: Campers do not upload videos to any video sharing platform during camp; instead, campers are provided with instructions for how to upload their projects to a video sharing platform with the help of parents at home. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: Minecraft Coding (Ages 9-13) - Brunswick, OH
description: In Minecraft Coding Camp, kids don't just play Minecraft, they create their own worlds with code! If your child loves Minecraft and wants to learn how to design and program new ideas into their worlds, then they will love this awesome camp. Kids become the ruler of their own world, controlling mobs and creatures, and learning to change, customize and edit their tools and weapons. Campers learn how to code with a block-based visual programming language inside MinecraftEdu, using if-then and while-do statements, variables, and loops. Redstone software is used to create circuits and switches to control objects. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

description: In Game Builders Camp, campers build on their love of video games by learning how to make their own. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

program:
{'title': 'Classroom Antics', 'description': '

Mission Statement

To inspire, excite, and enrich the lives of children in today\'s world focused on science and technology. To deliver educational hands-on STEM\xa0programs that promote enrichment, creativity, and teamwork in the safest environment possible. And most importantly, have fun.

Why the Company was Founded

Classroom Antics was established to address the rising demand for STEM-based childhood education. Over the past decades, our world has been turned upside-down with technological and scientific advances. Today, children are more comfortable with video games than board games, and more likely to read books on a smart device than in paperback. But how do we prepare our children to use and, better yet, invent tomorrow\'s technological or scientific advancement? Classroom Antics was formed to help kids do just that, apply their knowledge and creativity, to learn to make the next round of advancements in our world for themselves. We do this using a series of hands-on enrichment programs focused on the key areas of Science, Technology\ufeff, Engineering and Math (STEM) using curriculums\ufeff that\xa0are engaging and fun to appeal to young minds.\xa0

Who are our Teachers\xa0

We hire the best and brightest teachers to educate your children. They are leaders in their communities and contribute to children\'s education on a regular basis. Most of our instructors are school teachers with previous classroom experience. As well, all instructors are fingerprinted and background checked through the FBI (National) and BCI (State of Ohio) database systems to ensure the safest possible classroom environment.

title: Kid Coders (Ages 6-8) - Brunswick, OH
description: In Kid Coders Camp, campers learn and apply code to animate stories, create games, and make characters that move, jump, dance, and sing. Kid Coders is designed to match a young child's cognitive, personal, social, and emotional development and encourage them to have fun creating with code. In this summer kid coding camp kids use ScratchJr visual programming language. Note: tablets provided by Classroom Antics are used in this camp. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: Brick Flicks (Ages 9-13) - Brunswick, OH
description: Lights, Camera, LEGO! In Brick Flicks Film Camp, campers get to make multiple stop motion animation movies while learning techniques like video editing, voice over, captioning, and green-screening. Campers get to use their creativity, LEGO bricks, and LEGO mini-figures to develop their very own stories and put them on film. Stop-motion movies produced in camp are saved on a complementary USB drive to share with friends and family on Windows or Mac computers. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: LEGO Robotics (Ages 10-13) - Brunswick, OH
description: In LEGO Robotics Camp, become a leader of tomorrow by learning how to engineer solutions for some of today's real-world challenges. Kids learn engineering, automation, and problem-solving while programming their LEGO robots to solve a series of innovative challenges. A key advantage to this LEGO Robotics Camp is that campers use a dedicated laptop and LEGO Mindstorms EV3 Robotics kit during the camp for fully engaged learning. LEGO robots remain at camp; pictures of robots and LEGO creations are digitally sent home after camp. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: LEGO Bots (Ages 7-9) - Brunswick, OH
description: In LEGO Bots Camp, kids bring their LEGO creations to life. Using LEGO WeDo technology, campers will build multiple animal-themed robots and code them to complete tasks, react with sensors, and emit sounds. Campers also gain an age appropriate understanding of environmental science in this camp. LEGO robots remain at camp; pictures of robots and LEGO creations are digitally sent home after camp. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: Video Game Design (Ages 10-13) - Northville, MI
description: In Game Design Camp, campers transform from gamer into game developer! Kids take their passion for video games to a new level by learning to develop their own playable video games. Campers design an array of arcade-style video games by applying key skills of character development, environment creation, and innovative gameplay with GameMaker software. Kids are provided access to a copy of the GameMaker software and a library of graphics and music files to continue to develop the video games they make in camp or create new ones. Video games produced in camp are saved on a complementary USB drive to play with friends and family on Windows computers. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: TubeStars (Ages 10-13) - Northville, MI
description: Does your child dream of becoming the next big YouTube star? In TubeStars Camp, campers learn the entire video production process: storyboarding, scripting, filming, editing, and promotion. Campers use webcams, ring lights, and Shotcut for Windows to create multiple types of YouTube videos. Videos created in this camp are saved on a complimentary USB drive to share with friends or family on Windows and Mac computers. Special Note: Campers do not upload videos to any video sharing platform during camp; instead, campers are provided with instructions for how to upload their projects to a video sharing platform with the help of parents at home. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: Minecraft Coding (Ages 9-13) - Northville, MI
description: In Minecraft Coding Camp, kids don't just play Minecraft, they create their own worlds with code! If your child loves Minecraft and wants to learn how to design and program new ideas into their worlds, then they will love this awesome camp. Kids become the ruler of their own world, controlling mobs and creatures, and learning to change, customize and edit their tools and weapons. Campers learn how to code with a block-based visual programming language inside MinecraftEdu, using if-then and while-do statements, variables, and loops. Redstone software is used to create circuits and switches to control objects. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: LEGO Robotics (Ages 10-13) - Northville, MI
description: In LEGO Robotics Camp, become a leader of tomorrow by learning how to engineer solutions for some of today's real-world challenges. Kids learn engineering, automation, and problem-solving while programming their LEGO robots to solve a series of innovative challenges. A key advantage to this LEGO Robotics Camp is that campers use a dedicated laptop and LEGO Mindstorms EV3 Robotics kit during the camp for fully engaged learning. LEGO robots remain at camp; pictures of robots and LEGO creations are digitally sent home after camp. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: Brick Flicks (Ages 9-13) - Northville, MI
description: Lights, Camera, LEGO! In Brick Flicks Film Camp, campers get to make multiple stop motion animation movies while learning techniques like video editing, voice over, captioning, and green-screening. Campers get to use their creativity, LEGO bricks, and LEGO mini-figures to develop their very own stories and put them on film. Stop-motion movies produced in camp are saved on a complementary USB drive to share with friends and family on Windows or Mac computers. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

program:
{'title': 'Classroom Antics', 'description': '

Mission Statement

To inspire, excite, and enrich the lives of children in today\'s world focused on science and technology. To deliver educational hands-on STEM\xa0programs that promote enrichment, creativity, and teamwork in the safest environment possible. And most importantly, have fun.

Why the Company was Founded

Classroom Antics was established to address the rising demand for STEM-based childhood education. Over the past decades, our world has been turned upside-down with technological and scientific advances. Today, children are more comfortable with video games than board games, and more likely to read books on a smart device than in paperback. But how do we prepare our children to use and, better yet, invent tomorrow\'s technological or scientific advancement? Classroom Antics was formed to help kids do just that, apply their knowledge and creativity, to learn to make the next round of advancements in our world for themselves. We do this using a series of hands-on enrichment programs focused on the key areas of Science, Technology\ufeff, Engineering and Math (STEM) using curriculums\ufeff that\xa0are engaging and fun to appeal to young minds.\xa0

Who are our Teachers\xa0

We hire the best and brightest teachers to educate your children. They are leaders in their communities and contribute to children\'s education on a regular basis. Most of our instructors are school teachers with previous classroom experience. As well, all instructors are fingerprinted and background checked through the FBI (National) and BCI (State of Ohio) database systems to ensure the safest possible classroom environment.

title: LEGO Bots (Ages 7-9) - Northville, MI
description: In LEGO Bots Camp, kids bring their LEGO creations to life. Using LEGO WeDo technology, campers will build multiple animal-themed robots and code them to complete tasks, react with sensors, and emit sounds. Campers also gain an age appropriate understanding of environmental science in this camp. LEGO robots remain at camp; pictures of robots and LEGO creations are digitally sent home after camp. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: Video Game Design (Ages 10-13) - Rochester, MI
description: In Game Design Camp, campers transform from gamer into game developer! Kids take their passion for video games to a new level by learning to develop their own playable video games. Campers design an array of arcade-style video games by applying key skills of character development, environment creation, and innovative gameplay with GameMaker software. Kids are provided access to a copy of the GameMaker software and a library of graphics and music files to continue to develop the video games they make in camp or create new ones. Video games produced in camp are saved on a complementary USB drive to play with friends and family on Windows computers. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: TubeStars (Ages 10-13) - Rochester, MI
description: Does your child dream of becoming the next big YouTube star? In TubeStars Camp, campers learn the entire video production process: storyboarding, scripting, filming, editing, and promotion. Campers use webcams, ring lights, and Shotcut for Windows to create multiple types of YouTube videos. Videos created in this camp are saved on a complimentary USB drive to share with friends or family on Windows and Mac computers. Special Note: Campers do not upload videos to any video sharing platform during camp; instead, campers are provided with instructions for how to upload their projects to a video sharing platform with the help of parents at home. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: Minecraft Coding (Ages 9-13) - Rochester, MI
description: In Minecraft Coding Camp, kids don't just play Minecraft, they create their own worlds with code! If your child loves Minecraft and wants to learn how to design and program new ideas into their worlds, then they will love this awesome camp. Kids become the ruler of their own world, controlling mobs and creatures, and learning to change, customize and edit their tools and weapons. Campers learn how to code with a block-based visual programming language inside MinecraftEdu, using if-then and while-do statements, variables, and loops. Redstone software is used to create circuits and switches to control objects. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

description: In LEGO Robotics Camp, become a leader of tomorrow by learning how to engineer solutions for some of today's real-world challenges. title: Brick Flicks (Ages 9-13) - Rochester, MI
description: Lights, Camera, LEGO! In Brick Flicks Film Camp, campers get to make multiple stop motion animation movies while learning techniques like video editing, voice over, captioning, and green-screening. Campers get to use their creativity, LEGO bricks, and LEGO mini-figures to develop their very own stories and put them on film. Stop-motion movies produced in camp are saved on a complementary USB drive to share with friends and family on Windows or Mac computers. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: LEGO Bots (Ages 7-9) - Rochester, MI
description: In LEGO Bots Camp, kids bring their LEGO creations to life. Using LEGO WeDo technology, campers will build multiple animal-themed robots and code them to complete tasks, react with sensors, and emit sounds. Campers also gain an age appropriate understanding of environmental science in this camp. LEGO robots remain at camp; pictures of robots and LEGO creations are digitally sent home after camp. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: Video Game Design (Ages 10-13) - Northville, MI
description: In Game Design Camp, campers transform from gamer into game developer! Kids take their passion for video games to a new level by learning to develop their own playable video games. Campers design an array of arcade-style video games by applying key skills of character development, environment creation, and innovative gameplay with GameMaker software. Kids are provided access to a copy of the GameMaker software and a library of graphics and music files to continue to develop the video games they make in camp or create new ones. Video games produced in camp are saved on a complementary USB drive to play with friends and family on Windows computers. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: TubeStars (Ages 10-13) - Northville, MI
description: Does your child dream of becoming the next big YouTube star? In TubeStars Camp, campers learn the entire video production process: storyboarding, scripting, filming, editing, and promotion. Campers use webcams, ring lights, and Shotcut for Windows to create multiple types of YouTube videos. Videos created in this camp are saved on a complimentary USB drive to share with friends or family on Windows and Mac computers. Special Note: Campers do not upload videos to any video sharing platform during camp; instead, campers are provided with instructions for how to upload their projects to a video sharing platform with the help of parents at home. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: Minecraft Coding (Ages 9-13) - Northville, MI
description: In Minecraft Coding Camp, kids don't just play Minecraft, they create their own worlds with code! If your child loves Minecraft and wants to learn how to design and program new ideas into their worlds, then they will love this awesome camp. Kids become the ruler of their own world, controlling mobs and creatures, and learning to change, customize and edit their tools and weapons. Campers learn how to code with a block-based visual programming language inside MinecraftEdu, using if-then and while-do statements, variables, and loops. Redstone software is used to create circuits and switches to control objects. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

program:
{'title': 'Classroom Antics', 'description': '

Mission Statement

To inspire, excite, and enrich the lives of children in today\'s world focused on science and technology. To deliver educational hands-on STEM\xa0programs that promote enrichment, creativity, and teamwork in the safest environment possible. And most importantly, have fun.

Why the Company was Founded

Classroom Antics was established to address the rising demand for STEM-based childhood education. Over the past decades, our world has been turned upside-down with technological and scientific advances. Today, children are more comfortable with video games than board games, and more likely to read books on a smart device than in paperback. But how do we prepare our children to use and, better yet, invent tomorrow\'s technological or scientific advancement? Classroom Antics was formed to help kids do just that, apply their knowledge and creativity, to learn to make the next round of advancements in our world for themselves. We do this using a series of hands-on enrichment programs focused on the key areas of Science, Technology\ufeff, Engineering and Math (STEM) using curriculums\ufeff that\xa0are engaging and fun to appeal to young minds.\xa0

Who are our Teachers\xa0

We hire the best and brightest teachers to educate your children. They are leaders in their communities and contribute to children\'s education on a regular basis. Most of our instructors are school teachers with previous classroom experience. As well, all instructors are fingerprinted and background checked through the FBI (National) and BCI (State of Ohio) database systems to ensure the safest possible classroom environment.

title: LEGO Robotics (Ages 10-13) - Northville, MI
description: In LEGO Robotics Camp, become a leader of tomorrow by learning how to engineer solutions for some of today's real-world challenges. Kids learn engineering, automation, and problem-solving while programming their LEGO robots to solve a series of innovative challenges. A key advantage to this LEGO Robotics Camp is that campers use a dedicated laptop and LEGO Mindstorms EV3 Robotics kit during the camp for fully engaged learning. LEGO robots remain at camp; pictures of robots and LEGO creations are digitally sent home after camp. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: Brick Flicks (Ages 9-13) - Northville, MI
description: Lights, Camera, LEGO! In Brick Flicks Film Camp, campers get to make multiple stop motion animation movies while learning techniques like video editing, voice over, captioning, and green-screening. Campers get to use their creativity, LEGO bricks, and LEGO mini-figures to develop their very own stories and put them on film. Stop-motion movies produced in camp are saved on a complementary USB drive to share with friends and family on Windows or Mac computers. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: LEGO Bots (Ages 7-9) - Northville, MI
description: In LEGO Bots Camp, kids bring their LEGO creations to life. Using LEGO WeDo technology, campers will build multiple animal-themed robots and code them to complete tasks, react with sensors, and emit sounds. Campers also gain an age appropriate understanding of environmental science in this camp. LEGO robots remain at camp; pictures of robots and LEGO creations are digitally sent home after camp. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: Game Builders (Ages 7-9) - Troy, MI
description: In Game Builders Camp, campers build on their love of video games by learning how to make their own. Kids design their own video games with exciting challenges, innovative gameplay, and fun characters using the software Kodu from Microsoft. Campers are encouraged to play each other's games, offering feedback, suggestions and encouragement. Video games created in this camp are saved on a complimentary USB drive to play with friends and family on Windows computers. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: Video Game Design (Ages 10-13) - Troy, MI
description: In Game Design Camp, campers transform from gamer into game developer! Kids take their passion for video games to a new level by learning to develop their own playable video games. Campers design an array of arcade-style video games by applying key skills of character development, environment creation, and innovative gameplay with GameMaker software. Kids are provided access to a copy of the GameMaker software and a library of graphics and music files to continue to develop the video games they make in camp or create new ones. Video games produced in camp are saved on a complementary USB drive to play with friends and family on Windows computers. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: Creative Coders (Ages 8-12) - Troy, MI
description: Creative Coders Camp is a perfect introduction to coding! Kids have a blast using Scratch and Makey Makey, as well as both sides of their brain to program their own animated stories and interactive games. The visual programming language used in this camp is simple and straightforward, yet powerful in what it teaches and can accomplish. Programs created in this camp are playable on Windows computers and are saved on a complimentary USB drive to share with friends and family at home. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: TubeStars (Ages 10-13) - Troy, MI
description: Does your child dream of becoming the next big YouTube star? In TubeStars Camp, campers learn the entire video production process: storyboarding, scripting, filming, editing, and promotion. Campers use webcams, ring lights, and Shotcut for Windows to create multiple types of YouTube videos. Videos created in this camp are saved on a complimentary USB drive to share with friends or family on Windows and Mac computers. Special Note: Campers do not upload videos to any video sharing platform during camp; instead, campers are provided with instructions for how to upload their projects to a video sharing platform with the help of parents at home. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: Minecraft Coding (Ages 9-13) - Troy, MI
description: In Minecraft Coding Camp, kids don't just play Minecraft, they create their own worlds with code! If your child loves Minecraft and wants to learn how to design and program new ideas into their worlds, then they will love this awesome camp. Kids become the ruler of their own world, controlling mobs and creatures, and learning to change, customize and edit their tools and weapons. Campers learn how to code with a block-based visual programming language inside MinecraftEdu, using if-then and while-do statements, variables, and loops. Redstone software is used to create circuits and switches to control objects. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: LEGO Robotics (Ages 10-13) - Troy, MI
description: In LEGO Robotics Camp, become a leader of tomorrow by learning how to engineer solutions for some of today's real-world challenges. Kids learn engineering, automation, and problem-solving while programming their LEGO robots to solve a series of innovative challenges. A key advantage to this LEGO Robotics Camp is that campers use a dedicated laptop and LEGO Mindstorms EV3 Robotics kit during the camp for fully engaged learning. LEGO robots remain at camp; pictures of robots and LEGO creations are digitally sent home after camp. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: Brick Flicks (Ages 9-13) - Troy, MI
description: Lights, Camera, LEGO! In Brick Flicks Film Camp, campers get to make multiple stop motion animation movies while learning techniques like video editing, voice over, captioning, and green-screening. Campers get to use their creativity, LEGO bricks, and LEGO mini-figures to develop their very own stories and put them on film. Stop-motion movies produced in camp are saved on a complementary USB drive to share with friends and family on Windows or Mac computers. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: Amazing Architects (Ages 6-9) - Springboro, OH
description: Does your child love to build and create? Then your future engineer will love Amazing Architects Camp. In this camp, kids learn what it means to be an Architectural Engineer. Through hands-on activities, campers develop a city, build skyscrapers, model suspension bridges, and environmentally-friendly cars. Then, they take to the skies and learn about planes - how they work, how they're designed, and how to make them fly faster and longer. Note: Computers are not used in this camp; and if your child was enrolled in Amazing Architects or Planes Trains and Auto Engineers after school club, some of the material may be familiar. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: Video Game Design (Ages 10-13) - Springboro, OH
description: In Game Design Camp, campers transform from gamer into game developer! Kids take their passion for video games to a new level by learning to develop their own playable video games. Campers design an array of arcade-style video games by applying key skills of character development, environment creation, and innovative gameplay with GameMaker software. Kids are provided access to a copy of the GameMaker software and a library of graphics and music files to continue to develop the video games they make in camp or create new ones. Video games produced in camp are saved on a complementary USB drive to play with friends and family on Windows computers. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: Creative Coders (Ages 8-12) - Springboro, OH
description: Creative Coders Camp is a perfect introduction to coding! Kids have a blast using Scratch and Makey Makey, as well as both sides of their brain to program their own animated stories and interactive games. The visual programming language used in this camp is simple and straightforward, yet powerful in what it teaches and can accomplish. Programs created in this camp are playable on Windows computers and are saved on a complimentary USB drive to share with friends and family at home. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: TubeStars (Ages 10-13) - Springboro, OH
description: Does your child dream of becoming the next big YouTube star? In TubeStars Camp, campers learn the entire video production process: storyboarding, scripting, filming, editing, and promotion. Campers use webcams, ring lights, and Shotcut for Windows to create multiple types of YouTube videos. Videos created in this camp are saved on a complimentary USB drive to share with friends or family on Windows and Mac computers. Special Note: Campers do not upload videos to any video sharing platform during camp; instead, campers are provided with instructions for how to upload their projects to a video sharing platform with the help of parents at home. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: Minecraft Coding (Ages 9-13) - Springboro, OH
description: In Minecraft Coding Camp, kids don't just play Minecraft, they create their own worlds with code! If your child loves Minecraft and wants to learn how to design and program new ideas into their worlds, then they will love this awesome camp. Kids become the ruler of their own world, controlling mobs and creatures, and learning to change, customize and edit their tools and weapons. Campers learn how to code with a block-based visual programming language inside MinecraftEdu, using if-then and while-do statements, variables, and loops. Redstone software is used to create circuits and switches to control objects. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: Minecraft Coding (Ages 9-13) - Springboro, OH
description: In Minecraft Coding Camp, kids don't just play Minecraft, they create their own worlds with code! If your child loves Minecraft and wants to learn how to design and program new ideas into their worlds, then they will love this awesome camp. Kids become the ruler of their own world, controlling mobs and creatures, and learning to change, customize and edit their tools and weapons. Campers learn how to code with a block-based visual programming language inside MinecraftEdu, using if-then and while-do statements, variables, and loops. Redstone software is used to create circuits and switches to control objects. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: LEGO Robotics (Ages 10-13) - Springboro, OH
description: In LEGO Robotics Camp, become a leader of tomorrow by learning how to engineer solutions for some of today's real-world challenges. Kids learn engineering, automation, and problem-solving while programming their LEGO robots to solve a series of innovative challenges. A key advantage to this LEGO Robotics Camp is that campers use a dedicated laptop and LEGO Mindstorms EV3 Robotics kit during the camp for fully engaged learning. LEGO robots remain at camp; pictures of robots and LEGO creations are digitally sent home after camp. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: Brick Flicks (Ages 9-13) - Springboro, OH
description: Lights, Camera, LEGO! In Brick Flicks Film Camp, campers get to make multiple stop motion animation movies while learning techniques like video editing, voice over, captioning, and green-screening. Campers get to use their creativity, LEGO bricks, and LEGO mini-figures to develop their very own stories and put them on film. Stop-motion movies produced in camp are saved on a complementary USB drive to share with friends and family on Windows or Mac computers. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

description: In LEGO Bots Camp, kids bring their LEGO creations to life. Campers also gain an age appropriate understanding of environmental science in this camp. LEGO robots remain at camp; pictures of robots and LEGO creations are digitally sent home after camp. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: Amazing Architects (Ages 6-9) - Centerville, OH
description: Does your child love to build and create? Then your future engineer will love Amazing Architects Camp. In this camp, kids learn what it means to be an Architectural Engineer. Through hands-on activities, campers develop a city, build skyscrapers, model suspension bridges, and environmentally-friendly cars. Then, they take to the skies and learn about planes - how they work, how they're designed, and how to make them fly faster and longer. Note: Computers are not used in this camp; and if your child was enrolled in Amazing Architects or Planes Trains and Auto Engineers after school club, some of the material may be familiar. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: Video Game Design (Ages 10-13) - Centerville, OH
description: In Game Design Camp, campers transform from gamer into game developer! Kids take their passion for video games to a new level by learning to develop their own playable video games. Campers design an array of arcade-style video games by applying key skills of character development, environment creation, and innovative gameplay with GameMaker software. Kids are provided access to a copy of the GameMaker software and a library of graphics and music files to continue to develop the video games they make in camp or create new ones. Video games produced in camp are saved on a complementary USB drive to play with friends and family on Windows computers. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: TubeStars (Ages 10-13) - Centerville, OH
description: Does your child dream of becoming the next big YouTube star? In TubeStars Camp, campers learn the entire video production process: storyboarding, scripting, filming, editing, and promotion. Campers use webcams, ring lights, and Shotcut for Windows to create multiple types of YouTube videos. Videos created in this camp are saved on a complimentary USB drive to share with friends or family on Windows and Mac computers. Special Note: Campers do not upload videos to any video sharing platform during camp; instead, campers are provided with instructions for how to upload their projects to a video sharing platform with the help of parents at home. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

description: Creative Coders Camp is a perfect introduction to coding! Programs created in this camp are playable on Windows computers and are saved on a complimentary USB drive to share with friends and family at home. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: Minecraft Coding (Ages 9-13) - Centerville, OH
description: In Minecraft Coding Camp, kids don't just play Minecraft, they create their own worlds with code! If your child loves Minecraft and wants to learn how to design and program new ideas into their worlds, then they will love this awesome camp. Kids become the ruler of their own world, controlling mobs and creatures, and learning to change, customize and edit their tools and weapons. Campers learn how to code with a block-based visual programming language inside MinecraftEdu, using if-then and while-do statements, variables, and loops. Redstone software is used to create circuits and switches to control objects. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: LEGO Robotics (Ages 10-13) - Centerville, OH
description: In LEGO Robotics Camp, become a leader of tomorrow by learning how to engineer solutions for some of today's real-world challenges. Kids learn engineering, automation, and problem-solving while programming their LEGO robots to solve a series of innovative challenges. LEGO robots remain at camp; pictures of robots and LEGO creations are digitally sent home after camp. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: Kid Coders (Ages 6-8) - Centerville, OH
description: In Kid Coders Camp, campers learn and apply code to animate stories, create games, and make characters that move, jump, dance, and sing. Kid Coders is designed to match a young child's cognitive, personal, social, and emotional development and encourage them to have fun creating with code. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: LEGO Bots (Ages 7-9) - Centerville, OH
description: In LEGO Bots Camp, kids bring their LEGO creations to life. Using LEGO WeDo technology, campers will build multiple animal-themed robots and code them to complete tasks, react with sensors, and emit sounds. Campers also gain an age appropriate understanding of environmental science in this camp. LEGO robots remain at camp; pictures of robots and LEGO creations are digitally sent home after camp. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: Video Game Design (Ages 10-13) - Marysville, OH
description: In Game Design Camp, campers transform from gamer into game developer! Kids take their passion for video games to a new level by learning to develop their own playable video games. Campers design an array of arcade-style video games by applying key skills of character development, environment creation, and innovative gameplay with GameMaker software. Kids are provided access to a copy of the GameMaker software and a library of graphics and music files to continue to develop the video games they make in camp or create new ones. Video games produced in camp are saved on a complementary USB drive to play with friends and family on Windows computers. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: Creative Coders (Ages 8-12) - Marysville, OH
description: Creative Coders Camp is a perfect introduction to coding! Kids have a blast using Scratch and Makey Makey, as well as both sides of their brain to program their own animated stories and interactive games. Programs created in this camp are playable on Windows computers and are saved on a complimentary USB drive to share with friends and family at home. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: Brick Flicks (Ages 9-13) - Centerville, OH
description: Lights, Camera, LEGO! In Brick Flicks Film Camp, campers get to make multiple stop motion animation movies while learning techniques like video editing, voice over, captioning, and green-screening. Stop-motion movies produced in camp are saved on a complementary USB drive to share with friends and family on Windows or Mac computers. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: TubeStars (Ages 10-13) - Marysville, OH
description: Does your child dream of becoming the next big YouTube star? In TubeStars Camp, campers learn the entire video production process: storyboarding, scripting, filming, editing, and promotion. Campers use webcams, ring lights, and Shotcut for Windows to create multiple types of YouTube videos. Videos created in this camp are saved on a complimentary USB drive to share with friends or family on Windows and Mac computers. Special Note: Campers do not upload videos to any video sharing platform during camp; instead, campers are provided with instructions for how to upload their projects to a video sharing platform with the help of parents at home. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

title: Minecraft Coding (Ages 9-13) - Marysville, OH
description: In Minecraft Coding Camp, kids don't just play Minecraft, they create their own worlds with code! If your child loves Minecraft and wants to learn how to design and program new ideas into their worlds, then they will love this awesome camp. Kids become the ruler of their own world, controlling mobs and creatures, and learning to change, customize and edit their tools and weapons. Campers learn how to code with a block-based visual programming language inside MinecraftEdu, using if-then and while-do statements, variables, and loops. Redstone software is used to create circuits and switches to control objects. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.

Mission Statement

To inspire, excite, and enrich the lives of children in today\'s world focused on science and technology. To deliver educational hands-on STEM\xa0programs that promote enrichment, creativity, and teamwork in the safest environment possible. And most importantly, have fun.

Why the Company was Founded

Classroom Antics was established to address the rising demand for STEM-based childhood education. Over the past decades, our world has been turned upside-down with technological and scientific advances. Today, children are more comfortable with video games than board games, and more likely to read books on a smart device than in paperback. But how do we prepare our children to use and, better yet, invent tomorrow\'s technological or scientific advancement? Classroom Antics was formed to help kids do just that, apply their knowledge and creativity, to learn to make the next round of advancements in our world for themselves. We do this using a series of hands-on enrichment programs focused on the key areas of Science, Technology\ufeff, Engineering and Math (STEM) using curriculums\ufeff that\xa0are engaging and fun to appeal to young minds.\xa0

Who are our Teachers\xa0

We hire the best and brightest teachers to educate your children. They are leaders in their communities and contribute to children\'s education on a regular basis. As well, all instructors are fingerprinted and background checked through the FBI (National) and BCI (State of Ohio) database systems to ensure the safest possible classroom environment.

title: LEGO Robotics (Ages 10-13) - Marysville, OH
description: In LEGO Robotics Camp, become a leader of tomorrow by learning how to engineer solutions for some of today's real-world challenges. Kids learn engineering, automation, and problem-solving while programming their LEGO robots to solve a series of innovative challenges. A key advantage to this LEGO Robotics Camp is that campers use a dedicated laptop and LEGO Mindstorms EV3 Robotics kit during the camp for fully engaged learning. LEGO robots remain at camp; pictures of robots and LEGO creations are digitally sent home after camp. Enroll today as space is limited. Our registration system shows real-time availability. Call us if you have any questions.
